name: Diamonds
data_intro: This classic dataset contains the prices and other attributes of almost 54,000 diamonds. It's a great dataset for beginners learning to work with data analysis and visualization.

cat_feature_intro.cut: **cut** quality of the cut (Fair, Good, Very Good, Premium, Ideal)
cat_feature_intro.color: **color** diamond colour, from J (worst) to D (best)
cat_feature_intro.clarity: **clarity** a measurement of how clear the diamond is (I1 (worst), SI2, SI1, VS2, VS1, VVS2, VVS1, IF (best))

num_feature_intro.depth: **depth** total depth percentage = z / mean(x, y) = 2 * z / (x + y) (43--79)
num_feature_intro.table: **table** width of top of diamond relative to widest point (43--95)
num_feature_intro.x: **depth** total depth percentage = z / mean(x, y) = 2 * z / (x + y) (43--79)
num_feature_intro.y: **depth** total depth percentage = z / mean(x, y) = 2 * z / (x + y) (43--79)
num_feature_intro.z: **depth** total depth percentage = z / mean(x, y) = 2 * z / (x + y) (43--79)
